Provides a resource to create a mariadb instance_config

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.tencentcloud.Mariadb.InstanceConfig;
import com.pulumi.tencentcloud.Mariadb.InstanceConfigArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        var test = new InstanceConfig("test", InstanceConfigArgs.builder()        
            .extranetAccess(0)
            .instanceId("tdsql-9vqvls95")
            .rsAccessStrategy(1)
            .subnetId("subnet-3ku415by")
            .vip("127.0.0.1")
            .vpcId("vpc-ii1jfbhl")
            .build());

    }
}
```
```yaml
resources:
  test:
    type: tencentcloud:Mariadb:InstanceConfig
    properties:
      extranetAccess: 0
      instanceId: tdsql-9vqvls95
      rsAccessStrategy: 1
      subnetId: subnet-3ku415by

```

The InstanceConfig resource accepts the following [input](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) properties:



<div>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>

</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="rsaccessstrategy_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#rsaccessstrategy_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Rs<wbr>Access<wbr>Strategy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>RS proximity mode, 0- no strategy, 1- access to the nearest available zone.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

## Look up Existing InstanceConfig Resource {#look-up}

Get an existing InstanceConfig resource's state with the given name, ID, and optional extra properties used to qualify the lookup.

## Import



mariadb instance_config can be imported using the id, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import tencentcloud:Mariadb/instanceConfig:InstanceConfig test id
```

<dl class="package-details">
	<dt>Repository</dt>
	<dd><a href="https://github.com/tencentcloudstack/pulumi-tencentcloud">tencentcloud tencentcloudstack/pulumi-tencentcloud</a></dd>
	<dt>License</dt>
	<dd>Apache-2.0</dd>
	<dt>Notes</dt>
	<dd><p>This Pulumi package is based on the <a href="https://github.com/tencentcloudstack/terraform-provider-tencentcloud"><code>tencentcloud</code> Terraform Provider</a>.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
